div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: FCS expands campus opportunities to include an Environmental Club

a.span: FCS expands campus opportunities to include an Environmental Club

div.p: Students are able to participate in many environmental educational experiences, such as coring pine trees to determine age, transplanting important estuary plants, as well as learning how to maintain a saltwater aquarium.

a.title: Go to comments for FCS expands campus opportunities to include an Environmental Club

div.p: As a restorative practice district, we encourage our students & staff to build positive, healthy relationships.

a.title: Go to comments for Celebrate Friendship Month

img.alt: Board Recognizes December Employees of the Month

a.span: Board Recognizes December Employees of the Month

div.p: Congratulations to Mrs. Hartzog, Mrs. Mathews & Ms. Ritz

a.title: Go to comments for Board Recognizes December Employees of the Month

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.title: FOCUS Parent Portal

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: "Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail regarding official business to the District or any of its employees. Instead, contact the District or individual employee by phone or in writing."

a.title: Go to comments for Notice:

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.title: Report Fraud

span.strong: This page is reserved for questions, comments or concerns that are directly related to the mismanagement of funds, abuse of power or any other fraudulent activity.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: FCS 2020-21 New Student Enrollment: A fillable form may be downloaded and printed by visiting 2020-21 Registration Packet. Contact the District Office with any questions regarding new student registration @ 850.670.2810.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-21 New Student Registration Packet

span.span: Leadership Program Opportunity: The Bezos Scholars Program is a year-long leadership program for juniors & educators. Each year 12 students across the US and an accompanying educator are selected. The program includes an all-expenses-paid trip and mentorship, leadership development and scholarship $$. If you are a Seahawk Junior interested in applying please visit Bezos Scholarship Program.

a.title: Go to comments for Bezos Leadership Opportunity

span.span: Assessment Calendar: For specific information regarding FSA and EOC testing dates visit the 2019-20 Assessment Info.

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-20 Assessment Calendar

span.span: PanCare Dental Services: The Franklin County School District has partnered with PanCare to provide preventive dental care for students. Preventive treatments include dental examinations, cleanings, fluoride treatments and sealants which are done on campus at no cost to parents/guardians. If your child has Medicaid or any other dental insurance it may be billed for services rendered on campus. To participate in the PanCare Dental services please complete the Dental Form and return to the school.

a.title: Go to comments for Pancare Dental

span.span: 2019-20 School Calendar Now Available: To view visit 2019-20 Board Approved Calendar

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-20 District Calendar

span.span: FCS Activities Calendar: Never miss another Seahawk event or campus actvity. Visit FCS Calendar to sync the FCS Activities Calendar to your mobile device or google calendar.

a.title: Go to comments for FCS Activities Calendar

span.span: Florida School Choice: The Family Empowerment Scholarship (FES) Program provides eligible students a scholarship to attend a private school selected by the parent. For more information visit FES Program.

a.title: Go to comments for Florida School Choice, FES Scholarship

span.img: The Franklin County School District is committed to maintaining a safe and respectful learning environment. As part of our efforts to assure that all of our students and staff feel safe at school, we are introducing a new resource: the Franklin Tip Line. Information about drugs, weapons, bullying, cyberbullying or other factors which may be harmful to students, staff or the school environment should be reported. Submit a written report by visiting Franklin Tip Line or you can call 850.999.5634 to record a message.

a.title: Go to comments for Franklin Tip Line

p.span: Parents/Students: Emergency planning, student safety and test prep resources are now available for parents and students. Visit Resource Links for great tips and tools to support student success.

a.title: Go to comments for Parent Resource Links

div.p: Guiding students toward a brighter tomorrow

div.span: The Franklin County School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, religion, military status, ancestry, or genetic information which are classes protected by State and/or Federal law in its programs and activities, including employment opportunities. The district also provides equal access to its facilities to the Boy Scouts and other patriotic youth groups, as required by the BoyScouts of America Equal Access Act. Questions, complaints or request for additional information regarding discrimination or harassment may be sent to: Karen Peddie, Director of Human Resources, 85 School Road, Eastpoint, Florida 32328 850-670-2810 X 4101, kpeddie@franklincountyschools.org
